Reviews.Title: “best Montreal experience”
Reviews.Author: Stuart C
Reviews.Content: l'Hotel de l'Institut has always been a treat to look forward to. Gorgeously appointed, wonderful service, perfect location (Metro and "trendy" rue St. Denis at the door) and healthy, good cuisine ... can't go wrong ...

Reviews.Title: “The breakfast is the winner”
Reviews.Author: BBKowalski
Reviews.Content: This modern hotel is pleasant enough. The rooms are well appointed and clean but slightly on the small side. It is about a half an hour walk from the old town, if you are a tourist, but it is in a nice neighbourhood with some trendy restaurants and cafes nearby. The staff are pleasant and courteous, in either English or French. The absolute winner for anyone staying here is the excellent buffet style breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: spud0018
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel - stayed in a renovated king room. Price included a fabulous buffet breakfast - as good as any other 5 star hotel. Staff were very attentive and helpful when questions or concerns raised. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bed and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Visitors1973
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel near the spanish quarter in Montreal. It's not easy to park around but there is a parking facilities near and the hotel also has a parking but I found it expensive. The room was big and the bed so confortable. They have a nespresso machine and they offer for free two capsules. The others are expensive. The breakfast is a nice and included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: Guyfromfaraway
Reviews.Content: I had hesitations about this choice because it is a "teaching" hotel, but I would definitely stay here again. In fact, I look forward to it. Mine friends and I stayed for 4 nights over New Years weekend. The front desk staff was very friendly throughout our stay. The rooms are beautiful and look exactly as advertised. Breakfast is included with the stay, but we didn't make it down for breakfast. On the day we checked out, the hotel was nice enough to prepare breakfast for us to go. The location is great. The hotel is part of the tourism institute and the building sits above the Sherbrooke Metro stop. You don't need a car during your stay. Taxis are always available right in front of the hotel, and you can walk to a variety of restaurants, bars, live music spots and other attractions. If you do drive, they have onsite parking. The front desk will also exchange currency for you, but only in small amounts at a time. We arrived too late to go to a bank or exchange location, so the $50 they exchanged for us was very much appreciated. The negatives: 1) No room service. This was only an issue for us on one night. We were out late or brought back leftovers on the other nights. 2) No bell service (I don't usually use this, but I thought I'd note it.) 3) Housekeeping forgot to replace bathroom tissue 2 days in a row. We called down to the front desk when we arrived one evening and the desk clerk brought some up. 4) Although the rooms have been remodeled, the bathrooms still have old subway tile which really takes away from the "new" feel of the room. Overall, I recommend this hotel. The negatives were minor and would not deter me from staying again. We very much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Ozzy M
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. Having a balcony was a big bonus as well. Parked in the underground garage, with easy elevator access. Can't find anything to complain about as far as the service goes. We asked for an hour extra for checkout and was granted with no fuss what so ever. The location is superb. Walking distance to St Denis/Laurent restaurants, shops, bars, etc. Metro access pretty much behind the building, can't get better than that. The breakfast is the regular eggs, etc. Nothing spectacular, but not bad either. Overall, definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: vita1219
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! I actually booked it based on reviews from other readers on this site so I decided to give back by writing a review and sharing my experience. The staff was amazing, very accommodating and always went out of their way. Natalie at the concierge was very helpful and accommodating as well as gave great suggestions. She recommended great activities (Notre Dame Basilica, Botanical Garden, Biodome, and my most favorite!!- a Scandinavian spa ) (the best massage i have ever had & most relaxing atmosphere) Hotel was modern and very clean, rooms were spacious. Location was perfect as it was 5 steps away form the Metro which takes you anywhere. Walking distance to Latin Quarters & China town, also walking distance to Old Port (as long as its not too cold). Breakfast was very good especially since it was included (only thing is they did not switch up the menu at all so by the end of the week we were looking for a change.) The restaurant was closed for the holidays so we were not able to take advantage of it (heard the food was great though) For the location, price, service & cleanliness I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “missed opportunity”
Reviews.Author: FSH_203
Reviews.Content: The newly decorated hotel rooms are very comfortable but have quirks--why offer only 2 pods of coffee with that lovely Nespresso machine (what if both guests want decaf)? Why not leave a pen for guests? How about some conditioner along with the shampoo and a soap for the bath as well as for the sink? Why not fix the TV so the picture is not distorted? The only real problem however is the slap-dash nature of the breakfast. It is wonderful to have it offered as part of the room cost but service was lackadaisical, food and supplies were not replenished, only store-bought white bread was offered when Montreal has the best bakeries in Canada , one of which is right across the street. Since there seems to be supervision of the hotel, why not have supervision of the restaurant and servers as well?

Reviews.Title: “Felt in love with this place”
Reviews.Author: Guillou_Guillou
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic short stay at this hotel. The room was very nice and confortable with a nice little balcony. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good expecially the pastry. The location is very convenient and just on top of the subway station Sherbrook.

Reviews.Title: “Once again an excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie R
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at Hotel de l'Institut in the last 3 years. The service continues to be excellent, the rooms are clean & quiet, the included breakfast offers good selection and is tasty and the location is great: close to Saint-Denis for good shopping (designer boutiques, home-decoration boutiques, shoes, and more!), right next to a subway station (I should say on top of it!), about 15 minutes away from Mont-Royal street for some more shopping and restaurants and a few stations away from the main downtown core. And if you have a chance, treat yourself to the restaurant on Saturday night: gastronomique cuisine prepared by students of the Institut. A very fine dinning experience and wonderful decor. But reserve at the same time as you reserve your room! Montrealers go there for fine dinning and they book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing service, fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: Patricia R
Reviews.Content: Just loved this hotel! Our room, with balcony was superb as was the breakfast. The extra touches - great lighting, good coffee all contributed to a wonderful stay. And then there was the service - my friend forgot a plug for her CPac machine. They located it and found a post office to express mail it to for us as we were traveling east. Then they phoned the post office to tell them we would be in contact. A+ to the team. Patricia from Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: WolfCreekFarm
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern rooms. Nice breakfast. Good location. The staff were very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Alex M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August for 4 nights. This hotel was modern, clean and very well located. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet, although smaller than some larger hotels was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JDLOttawa
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight in comfortable, well appointed and expansive suite. Small bathroom and small closet however. Great location near metro. Buffet breakfast in restaurant on premises included in rate. Good food but very poor service. Were seated, given coffee (and the check) and left on our own. No removal of plates, no coffee/water refills. Would stay again at hotel because of location - Would try the restaurant only because I believe in second chances!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and Very comfortable.....”
Reviews.Author: Ncholas-CYP
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel right next to the metro station which is a big plus!!!! Hotel was very clean and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. Bathroom was clean and big too. Breakfast was delicious, although bit limited selection but very fresh and tasty. Staff was ncie too. The only drawback was the noise coming out of the aircondition. I strongly recommend it and would love to stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, great stay”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaMaven
Reviews.Content: Lovely, modern hotel in a greal location. Parking and check-in were easy. Student staff members were uniformly attentive. Room was spacious and clean, bed was very comfortable, desk area was ample, bathroom was highly functional, coffee maker was a trip. Breakfast buffet on a Monday morning was excellent - nice setting, strong coffee, a variety of choices. Everything tasted fresh and real. Would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mean Security Guard”
Reviews.Author: KaPowMontreal
Reviews.Content: I was not staying at this hotel but I was passing by on my way home from work. I'm very obviously 8 Months pregnant and as I approached the hotel nature called and I needed to use a washroom asap. The hotel was the closest place that I could get to on short notice so I asked the security guard if I could quickly use the rest room. After he asked and I told him I wasn't a guest he would not let me past the entrance. I realize that there are policies and this guy was just doing as he was told, however, I thought it was a pretty cold hearted not to make an exception.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the fun part of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: MrEjection
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights at the Hotel de Lâ€™Institut based on Tripadvisor reviews, a DK Top 10 book, and some other internet resources. This hotel is great. I cannot say enough good things about it. The room is very spacious, quiet, and comfortable, as well as it has a patio. The bed is great and the desk area was more than enough. It was very nicely decorated as well. Having a glass of wine watching the sunset is great. We ate breakfast at the hotel twice, as it was included in the rate. The buffet was nice. The concierges were helpful. We did not eat dinner or lunch here as there are so many choices within a 1km radius. Keep in mind, this is a school for tourism, so a lot of the workers are in training. For the most part everything is fine. English is not a problem for anyone here. To give a comparison, we stayed at the Fairmont Chateau Laurier in Ottawa prior to taking a train to Montreal, and the hotel room was just as comfortable and spacious as my room in Ottawa. The building is attached to the Sherbrooke Metro / Subway station and a taxi stand is right outside the hotel, so getting around is very convenient. You are about a 15 â€“ 20 minute walk from Old Montreal, and the Rue St. Denis is a very fun and interesting street. Turning right out of the hotel the street is packed with boutique shops and restaurants. Turn left out of the hotel on Rue St. Denis and you are in the Latin Quarter, then Old Montreal. At the end of the day, I have no complaints about this hotel and only positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Easy as pie”
Reviews.Author: mscoppe
Reviews.Content: Our stay at L'Institue couldn't have been easier. We drove into Montreal- was quite easy to find, we parked underneath. Check-in was quick. the lobby is impeccable. Our room was unique and spotless. Terrace was a treat and the view was spectacular. The bed was remarkably comfortable. Breakfast was filling and a nice selection, excellent service from entire hotel staff- not one staff person did not greet me with bon-jour. I have no worries about where to stay when I visit Montreal in the future. Highly recommend L'Institue.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: MES34
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de l'Institut is in a great location for exploring the Plateau and Old Montreal on foot and for exploring the rest of Montreal by public transport. The breakfasts are delicious. The beds are very comfortable. It was great to have a balcony and we were lucky enough to be on the side of the building facing towards Sherbrooke, so we had a beautiful view too. We also enjoyed a delicious supper at the restaurant. We would highly recommend the Hotel de l'Institut!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beds and the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ChooChoo4427
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Hotel de l'Institut for two nights in July and had a really enjoyable stay. Apparently a few weeks prior to our stay, Prince William and Kate took a cooking class there. http://omg.yahoo.com/news/pics-prince-william-kate-don-chef-jackets-to-take-cooking-class/66415. I guess it's a very famous cooking school as well as a hotel school. We enjoyed it because it was so quiet and intimate. They only have 40 rooms, so there's never any hustle & bustle. The staff was extremely attentive and friendly. The rooms were very well appointed -- even had an iPhone/iPod charging station. They are decorated in a modern/tech look but not over the top. The beds were extremely comfortable -- probably the best of the 5 or 7 hotels we've stayed at in the past six months. Our room (#707), like most, had a small balcony (from which we saw some of the International fireworks competition). While not cramped, it was a smaller room than most American hotel rooms. The hot & cold buffet breakfast was excellent. A good selection of pastries, cereals and fruits and juices. The croissants were really tasty and they had crepes one day and french toast another. The dining room was light & airy and the service very attentive. A couple knocks would be... a) the heavy curtains didn't block out all the light, so the sun came in from the sides, etc., in the morning. b) the flat panel TV did not carry HD channels (or none that I noticed). c) the hotel only had one elevator for guests, but since it only serviced 40 rooms on only 2 floors, it never was a problem. d) price was good but not a bargain ($225/night) In our last visit to Montreal we had stayed in the old town, which was in close walking distance to the tourist sites. This visit we did fewer tourist attractions, so the location of Hotel de l'Institut worked out well for us. It's in the heart of the so many fantastic restaurants up and down rue St Denis. It's just a few block away from a park (Ã‰tangs du Parc La Fontaine) with playgrounds, ball fields and tennis courts and pretty close to Park Mont Royal. The hotel is also right on top of a metro stop. Parking was in a garage underneath the hotel and reasonably priced ($19/day).

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with my extended family. Although it is not in the Old City, we actually found it to be a more convenient location. It's right at a subway stop (with signs marking the hotel exit), plus a taxi stand right outside the restaurant & a BIXI bike rental stand across the street in the park. Rue St. Denis is also filled with a great assortment of reasonably priced restaurants & shops/boutiques. I kept on wanting to try so many that I passed. Room was extremely comfortable. It appears to be recently renovated & done very nicely. I will second another reviewer's comment that the water pressure (only noticeable at the sink) was a little weak, but nothing horrible. The balcony was a nice little perk, mine had a perfect view of the city & a church dome. Another family member's had the perfect view of the fireworks competition. The included breakfast was fabulous: great variety, quality accompanied by good service. Also had several lunches there as well. Very happy with the L'Institut & glad that we had a chance to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: hellosaraho
Reviews.Content: excellent location - the food was fantastic, we had breakfast included. The location is wonderful. Right on the subway line, a lovely walk along St Denis with the trendy and fun shops everywhere that cater to the people who live there and not the tourists. The rooms were new and so quiet. The beds comfy and new. We were impressed and very pleased with our choice. The only complaint was the water pressure was a little weak in the washroom. But everything else was excellent including the helpful staff. We will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - gorgeous hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: 1212rose1212
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous, modern hotel. The hotel part is small of the building which is part of a tourism institute and cooking school. Our room looked brand new. The beds were ultra comfortable, the bedding was plush, and our room had a balcony wint a spectacular view of Montreal. The hotel was also designed to be "green" with natural bath products and watersaving bath fixtures. The lobby was sparse but modern, and the concierge was incredibly helpful. One of the best parts, the breakfast - included with our room - was absolutely delicious. On Sunday there is a compelte breakfast buffet, and during the week we ordered off the menu. The waitstaff were wonderful. We loved the location, right across from a park with a wonderful creperie across the street, as well as close to Plateau and the pedestrian walkway near Rue St. Laurant. There were always cabs out front, but we used the metro as the Sherwood stop is right under the hotel and could not be more convenient. Parking is 19$ per day in lot under the hotel. Only drawback is that though wifi is free, the signal in our room was poor. We loved our stay there and would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “More than what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Patty1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to the excellent reviews at Tripadvisor.com and we love it. It is conveniently located just above the Metro Sherbooke station, one station away from the major hub of Berri-UQAM. It was so easy to get to the Convention Center as it is only 3 stations away. It is modern, clean, friendly and well equipped hotel. The staff at the reception were very professional and helpful. Only 2 floors are occupied by hotel rooms. The rest of the building is the hospitality school. Thus, it never felt crowded in any way. The hotel room was chic and modern and equipped with all the modern facilities including a refrigerator, Nespresso coffee machine, iron, hair dryer, flat screen TV, iPod charger and a nice office chair. Every room has a balcony with a great view of the city. The bed was really comfortable. WiFi is free of charge. We were most impressed by the breakfast which is free with the stay. We had a choice of egg Benedict, egg Florentine or egg with Salmon, crepes, pancake, fruits, cereals, croissant and other pastries, yogurt, salad, etc. Unlike previous reviews, we found the staff very responsive and the service was excellent during our stay. We wish we had a chance to try their $19 Express lunch but it was so popular and was booked out on the day when we wanted to try. Hotel guests also get 20% off for dinner on Tuesday and Wednesday but we did not have a chance to try it. Overall, we are very happy with this hotel and we will certainly return if we visit Montreal again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Big spacious rooms, close to metro, yummy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: giraffez
Reviews.Content: Booked directly through the hotel. Rate contains breakfast. Breakfast was delicious. Ordered the Salmon Egg Benedict on both mornings I was there. There is a mini buffet breakfast table containing yogurt, cereal (which was really yummy) and fine pastries for you to help yourself on top of the menu order. They gave me a 20% off dinner voucher for their restaurants to be used only on Tues and Wednesdays. I didn't try it as there were average reviews about dinner and menu wasn't too attractive. But breakfast i must mention again was delicious. Hotel entrance was a bit confusing. Not clearly marked at all. Hotel didn't feel very warm or welcoming at all. Just felt like people running in and out, wouldn't even know it was a hotel if i wasn't told. Front desk gave me an early check in which was great. My room was big and spacious. Air cond was a bit weird and noisy. Room had a balcony. Looks like recently renovated and very modern. Even had a mini sofa. Shower pressure was low, even the tap at the basin was low pressured. Room had electronic safe. Bed I felt was rather soft, and the quilt was rather dense and heavy which made me wake up a couple of times during the night. Other than that, room was clean. Front desk mixed up my morning call, i set at 4:30, and they wrote down 7:30. Since breakfast was included and i was leaving so early, they told me that can prepare a small breakfast box which they do everyday for people leaving early. The box contained a fruit, a croisant, a fruit drink and a piece of cheese. Apparently this is ready and sent to the front desk at midnight ready for customer pick up in the morning. Hotel is right next to Sherbrooke metro which was convenient. Berri station is about a 15 min walk and no elevators or escalators down to metro (that i could find from the bus terminal). This is where I caught the 747 shuttle to the airport. Had free wifi in room - need to ask for password. Network a bit congested though. The concierge in front of the restaurant was not very helpful, almost got the impression she wanted to waive me off quickly so she could get back to browsing the net. Also nearby hotel are restaurants... also very close to the seedy latin quarter (also full of restaurants and very weird people :)).

Reviews.Title: “Super modern hotel - with a couple of rough edges...”
Reviews.Author: balhannah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May, and absolutely loved the look and feel of the place. Cool, modern, edgy, minimalist but still welcoming. The reception staff (like all the staff here - it's a training institute) are young and perhaps a bit inexperienced, but their willingness to help and to provide advice more than made up for this. The room was outstanding - huge bed, excellent bathroom, a balcony looking over trendy rue St-Denis and a lovely park, with distant views of church spires and Mont-Royal. Great sunset. There were a couple of odd things: the lights over the bed simply didn't respond to any attempts to make them work. They were expensive and really very attractive - but I never did work out how to turn them on. Similarly, just call me old-fashioned, but a coffee machine that has FOUR PAGES of instructions seems to be over the top! The Nespresso thing seems to be complicated just for the sake of appearing sophisticated. Breakfast is included in the price and is served by yet more trainees. The first morning we had lovely service and excellent food but the second morning really let the side down. We arrived in the dining room and stood about waiting for someone to even acknowledge our presence. There was a great deal of bustling about, people clearing tables, laying new places, taking orders, entering stuff into the computer - but no-one even made eye contact with us. Eventually after about 7 minutes, we were taken to a table by a young woman - who then proceeded to completely ignore us again. I noticed that by now there were perhaps 5 or 6 people queueing at the entrance, being similarly ignored. I managed to grab the attention of one young man and asked if we could please have some service as we had been waiting for well over 5 minutes just to be acknowledged. He mockingly asked me, 'What? Not 6 minutes? Not 7 minutes?' I wasn't impressed frankly. He then arrived with coffee, took our order and bustled off to the kitchen - or somewhere. All up, it took over half an hour from the time we arrived at the restaurant to the time when our food arrived. Something wrong with the curriculum here - it's not a good idea to teach people to completely ignore the guests and then to mock them! But this long whinge aside, this is a great little hotel, really well situated above a metro station and very close to a vast range of restaurants (although beware - a lot of them I would classify as 'strictly tourist': lovely setting, outside tables, poor service and indifferent and expensive food). I would recommend the hotel, with the proviso that the service may be patchy.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: moishe613
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. Great location. The beds are awesome! The service at reception and breakfast was a little cool, though. Also, we awoke to a fire alarm and vague announcement that a "minor incident" was reported. We were instructed to immediately evacuate. By the time I gathered my family and belongings together, another announcement stated that the emergency was finished. There was no explanation. A sour end to a good experience, for the most part.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, great location, delicious breakfast but issues in rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Chiao
Reviews.Content: Spacious room with nice beds, delicious breakfast and great location. Staff friendly, good service. Unfortunately my room on the 8th floor near the elevator was noisy (ventilation?) and I couldn't get another room because the hotel was full the first two nights. After moving to the 7th floor on the other side, it was much better. The shower there couldn't be controlled well however, and gave luke warm water mixed with boiling hot water (ouch!). Also, there was no real lobby, no room service, not possible to have a drink without a reservation and confusing layout of the entrances. The internet connection was quite slow.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect except for staff.”
Reviews.Author: cachetoute
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location, room and view. Most comfortable bed I've ever slept on! Quiet. Nespresso in room -- so excellent. Excellent breakfast. But the *staff*: what gives? It felt more like we were being processed at a refugee centre at check-in; a burden and a bureaucratic ordeal to the indifferent staff. I was not going to even try and get more coffee at breakfast, since those begging for more around me were not getting anywhere. If a more unpleasant and inattentive server could be found, I'd be surprised. Happy to return, but I'll know to lower my service expectations first!

Reviews.Title: “The best to enjoy MontrÃ©al”
Reviews.Author: verolebel
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is expensive. But it is worth it: the service is impeccable, the double room is huge and cosy and the location is perfect (with a close access to the subway) to explore the great city of MontrÃ©al. Thumbs up to ITHQ students that are working hard to make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for anything better...!”
Reviews.Author: mayfly666
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? I've never written a review on Tripadvisor before but this mini-vacation compelled me to do so. I almost feel like I shouldn't because then the secret will be out! What a tremendous experience at the Hotel de L'Institut. Amazing location to call home base for four days, gorgeous and absolutely spotless room (with a balcony/priceless view) and warm and helpful staff. A stay worth four times what we actually paid. Did I mention the lovely breakfast that was included with our visit? Much, much more than your expected rubber waffles and burnt, greasy toast. Our only wish was a bar in the lobby which would have been lovely. However, given the location, so many choices live right around the way that we quickly overlooked this. We look forward to visiting again next fall!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, great food, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: lorlar
Reviews.Content: Our room was warmly furnished, sparkling clean, and had the most up-to-date features (Room 704). The bed and linens were first rate. A full breakfast was provided each day as part of the room package -- the dining area was sunny and lovely, and the menu was diverse (really enjoyed the eggs Florentine). The hotel is conveniently located in the same building as the Metro station, only two stops from Old Montreal and within walking distance of some excellent restaurants. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Chicona50
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to Montreal for a weekend getaway. Our stay at the Hotel de l'Institut was absolutely wonderful, the service was great, the rooms were very clean and tastefully decorated. As well, the location of the hotel in Montreal lends to easy access to many restaurants, shopping and walking distance to the Old Port of Montreal. I would highly recommend this hotel to all my friends and family!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rubberman542
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 6 days for a summer vacation in Montreal and couldn't have been happier. The rooms are modern, newly renovated and impeccably clean, the service phenomenal and the hotel is in a beautiful area of Montreal surrounded by eateries, bars, boutiques, etc. We very much enjoyed the free breakfast and It was amazing to wake up in the morning and have coffee on the balcony .The free internet was a great bonus as well. The only thing I could see as being a negative to some was that there was no bathtub, only a stand-up shower, so if you enjoy long baths that may be an annoyance. We found this hotel to be a real gem.... a 5 star experience for us and a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value (on sale) and good location for Plateau”
Reviews.Author: astroman
Reviews.Content: My newly-refurbished room was beautiful, with a balcony and a view (hotel rooms are on floors 7 and 8). Look for sales on their website. Friendly reception, incompetent concierge, OK breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: pinky78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night, booked online with the hotel-$144.00- it's a little more than I wanted to spend but included a king bed and a hot breakfast. Beds are great, super comfy! Bathroom is fine, shower head could be replaced. There is a nespresso coffee maker (which sold me when choosing on where to stay on mtl) is great, but you only get two pods, after that they are $2.10 each.... I suggest bringing your own if staying for a while. Breakfast was great, I had an omlette with croissants, fruit and yoghurt. Parking is $19/day, and not too many spots... Good luck. One more thing, having a balcony was awesome, enjoyed my coffee in the morning out there. Overall, highly recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem Indeed!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCurlyQ
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on great reviews here and we were not disappointed. Actually, it was even better than what we expected. The rooms are clean, modern and beautiful. Our balcony was great and we had an amazing view of the city. The beds were super comfy. Breakfast was included in our room rate. It was delicious! The portions were on the small side, however, everything was tasty. The service from front desk to at the table was very good. The location couldn't be any better. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location-great value”
Reviews.Author: madforkay
Reviews.Content: Our first time at this hotel. great room, great view, knowing staff, wonderful location and over the Metro Station. We will return. thanks

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: chilarg
Reviews.Content: I have been a client since inauguration in 1976. After a much needed renovation a few years ago, it is still a secret for most people. Conveniently located above the subway station Sherbrooke means that I do not need a car to go around Montreal, I use the metro to be in the office district in 5-10 minutes. I like free WI-FI internet in the room and free omelette for breakfast. Free sunset on the north side. No room service.No smoking in public areas. Only 40 rooms.No pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sage
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel so much, I included it in my Blog encouraging readders to try it out; Great value plus plus. We had a family get together.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Montreal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spinnaker47
Reviews.Content: Perhaps not the obvious choice for a Montreal hotel but it actually proved a perfect base for a brief stay in the city. It doesn't look like a hotel from the outside (though the guide book which called it the ugliest building in town was way off the mark). In fact it looks like a trendy office block on the outside, and its reception/foyer area wouldn't be out of place in a trendy ad agency. The (few) staff are incrediby young and incredibly attentive, preumably most are students at the Institute. The room was well equipped and all have small balconies with good views over the city. The bathrooms are admittedly quite small but perfectly adequate. A good buffet breakfast including waitress-delivered hot food was included. Although not downtown it's located in one of the tendiest areas of the city close to countless great bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: zoomfish
Reviews.Content: We were on a road trip through Quebec and were recommended this hotel on short notice. You can walk into town in about 15+ minutes. Subway nearby. The rooms are modern with secure locks and balconies, some with fair views. The hallways are wide enough you could drive a car down them. There is active securtiy personnel monitoring a very long lobby that connects the hotel to a restaurant on the ground floor. You can park your car in a garage with an automatic door that has elevator access to your rooms floor - it was not cheap; parking cost about $20/day but I thought worth it for our peace of mind the first time in this city. The beds were comfortable and the bath roomy, clean and modern. We were very happy with this choice. The hotel is a school and run by students and I think they do a very good job. The attached restaurant is also a school and that was the most pleasant surprise. They have a daily menu for dinner that was (for us) a six course meal for what we considered an absolute bargain. Even if you don't stay here, you should check out the restaurant. The atmosphere is a bit cool, almost as if you're in a cafeteria or conference center, but the food and service are excellent. It;s in a mixed use neighborhood with shops, office buildings, apartment buildings and restaurants; a little gritty in some corners but overall quite acceptable. We walked downtown to see some of the artists during the Jazz Festival, but there is a subway stop right nearby as well so you can around the whole city easily. We found this to be an excellent overall value, in a good location and one of the highlights of our trip. We would recommend it highly to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Accommodations, but lacking in customer service...”
Reviews.Author: Modesttraveller30
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably-priced, comfortable hotel that is very conveniently located near Sherbrooke metro station. The room (one queen bed with private bath and a small balcony) was clean. However, if you stay here, be warned that there is next to no customer service. When I called the reception to ask for extra towels, I was told "you were supposed to have them in the room, no?" I was not even transferred to housekeeping and the reception attendant rudely hung up the phone. In the end, I had to call housekeeping myself. Also, if you stay here, I would advise skipping the breakfast. I waited for an hour for food only to be told that because of some kind of 'problem' in the kitchen they were unable to make a crepe. At this point, I was so frustrated I cancelled the order, only to be given no apology or compensation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in the Institute”
Reviews.Author: AlKlecks
Reviews.Content: Just two blocks off of the Quartier Latin located it is very close to the action yet far enough to get a good nights sleep. I loved the modern interior. The very clean room was in the top floor facing north. Very good 2 queen size beds. The breakfeast in the morning was great and included. Parking is pretty steep ($18 per day) plus the $150 for the double bed 1 room is also not the cheapest. The staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in mid-September. It's staffed by students, with some professional (non-student) staff as well. Great service, everyone very helpful and pleasant. Good room, great bed (but very hard pillows!). The rooms have small balconies; ours had a view of Mont Royal itself. I think some rooms are handicapped-accessible. Parking is available for $15CD/day, charged to your room; breakfast is included in the restaurant downstairs. Very slow breakfast service! That's my only complaint. Husband loved it. Great location, close to everything, a subway stop right behind the hotel. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Room in Town Turned Out to Be Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: trinaunz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I rarely book hotels in advance when we travel because we like to keep a loose itinerary. We do, though, make up a list of about 10 local hotels in priority order and call them one by one when we arrive in town. This plan has never backfired on us EXCEPT when we stayed in Montreal. We had the unfortunate timing of arriving during Pierre Trudeau's funeral, which was being held there, and everything was sold out that we tried. Desperate, I asked for a recommendation from the last place I called about who might have a room left. I was advised to call Hotel de L'Institut. Between its "last to be picked for the team" status and its role in training hospitality students, you can imagine that my expectations were low when we arrived at the hotel. Turns out it was a perfectly pleasant experience. The room was clean, nicely appointed and sunny. The hotel is elegant, the service was good and we didn't even get gouged for our dilemna (about $95 per night, if memory serves). I would stay there again - even if there are other rooms available next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great place; great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have gone to l'Institut for many years (before recent remodeling). A very, very decent hotel and manageable proportions...really excellent sit-down breakfast...and a great location in the French district with lots of young, vibrant, people about. Very close to METRO and all the transit links. We'll go again.
